result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Bond form returned unsigned. Def refused.

Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 9/29/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

11:09 AM Defendant Leroy McCambry in court with Attorney Laura Breun.  ADA Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. Julie B. from Dane County Pretrial Services also at counsel table. 
Court and parties address multiple Pretrial Services Violation Reports. Statement by ADA Verhoff requesting cash bail be imposed. Statement by Attorney Breun regarding bail. Court sets cash bail in the amount of $500 and removes Dane County Pretrial Services. All other conditions remain the same.
DCPS Violation Report and Court's Response: all violations will be addressed at 9/29/22 bail hearing

Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 9/19/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services immediately upon release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, _X_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or _X_ Random Drug Testing. 
- Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not be at Rocky's Liquor and is banned from the 3000-3200 blocks of St. Paul Ave in Madison.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Grace C.
_x_ Regardless of when cash bail (if required) is posted, or when a signature bond is signed, the jail shall only release the defendant if the defendant can arrive at Pretrial Services between the hours of 8 am and 3 pm (Monday through Friday) unless the jail has cleared a later arrival time directly with Pretrial Services. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services

*** IN CUSTODY ***

10:32 AM Defendant Leroy McCambry in court with Attorney Laura Breun.  ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court orders signature bond and adds Dane County Pretrial Services for GPS, Remote Breath and Random Drug Testing. All other conditions remain the same.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

3:36 PM Defendant Leroy McCambry in court with Attorney Laura Breun.  ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State makes Motion to Dismiss Count 1 without prejudice. No Objection. Court Dismisses Count 1 without prejudice. Counts 2, 3, 4 and 5 remain.
Attorney Breun requests signature bond. Bail Bond Hearing scheduled for September 19th at 10:30
and returned.

The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, _X_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or _X_ Random Drug Testing.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

2:04 PM Defendant Leroy McCambry in court with Attorney Laura Breun.  ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court and parties discuss Competency Report dated 8/22/22. Defendant has no objection to Report and agrees he is competent. No objection by the State. Court find the defendant competent. 

Re: Bond
Statement by Attorney Breun requesting amendments to bond. Statement by ADA Lazarus. Court reduces the cash bail amount to $300 and will add the conditions of: gps monitoring, remote breath monitoring, and random drug testing. All other conditions remain the same.
Preliminary hearing on September 16, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

and Treatment (Incompetency)
Exhibit 1

11:59 AM Defendant appeared via zoom from the DCJ. Attorney Laura Breun appeared in person.  ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dr. Craig Schoenecker appeared via zoom. 

Court review of report of Dr. Schoenecker. State agrees with report. Statement by Defendant. Dr. Craig Schoenecker sworn. Exhibit 1 marked, entered and received. Parties stipulated to Dr. Schoenecker's qualifications. Direct exam by the State. Cross exam by the Defense. Motion by the State to Grant Order for Commitment of Treatment and the Defn is not competent.  Court finds Defendant is not currently competent but is likely to be after treatment. Defense requests forthwith transfer to be added to the Order.
